definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: I put it back into my palm.
sentences.chinese: 我把它重新放到我的手掌心。

sentences.english: How do you hold a moonbeam in your hand?
sentences.chinese: 该怎么把月光握在手掌心？

sentences.english: The palm of me hand to the tip of me left pinky, sir.
sentences.chinese: 从我的手掌心到我的左小指尖，先生。

sentences.english: Start with the bottoms of your palms by clasping your fingers and rubbing the heels of your palms together in a circular motion.
sentences.chinese: 用手指按摩手掌心和脚后跟绕圆周方向运动。

sentences.english: The rash does not itch and it is usually located on the palms of the hands and soles of the feet.
sentences.chinese: 这些疹子并不发痒，通常局限于手掌心和脚掌底。

sentences.english: Every time I look at the picture, though, my palms still get a little sweaty.
sentences.chinese: 不过每次我看到这张照片，我手掌心都还是会冒冷汗。

sentences.english: When he was born he was so small he could fit in the palm of your hand.
sentences.chinese: 在他出生的时候，他小到可以放在你的手掌心。

definition: palm (of one's hand)/control (extended meaning from having something in the palm of one's hand)
tiger's den/dangerous place/the web between the thumb and forefinger of a hand
the five fingers of one's hand
the power of sb or sth evil/the clutches (of a bad person etc)
pit of the stomach/solar plexus/words and thoughts
